message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.LG 

This paper deals with topic modelling in online discussions, which involves natural language processing and information retrieval techniques. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper proposes a new metric to quantify the popularity of comments and a concept to characterize topic dependency, which can be considered as social network analysis and graph theory, respectively. Hence, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is also a likely category. The paper also deals with large text datasets and scalability, which are common concerns in information retrieval, leading to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as another possible category. The paper also proposes a new model for topic extraction, which can be considered as a machine learning approach, leading to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as another possible category. Finally, the paper deals with online discussions, which can be considered as a form of social media, leading to cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing) as a less likely category.
